summary: The Strengthening Benefit Plans Act of 2025 proposes two main changes to the Internal Revenue Code. Firstly, it allows for the transfer of excess health plan assets to be used for active employee benefits. Secondly, it permits the transfer of surplus defined benefit plan assets to a defined contribution plan. The bill includes provisions regarding limitations, notice requirements, and effective dates for both types of transfers, aiming to support active employees regarding current and future benefits.
